title: Hardest skillshot in the game to land?
body: IMO it's close between {{champion:134}} E and {{champion:267}} Q. {{champion:103}} E is hard on the red side but not so much on blue side which is weird.

replies.body: Lux's W. Your teammates suddenly become Faker when you try to aim them.

> [{quoted}](name=DomainSpecific,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AAKVrFa5,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2015-05-23T06:35:34.893+0000)
>
> Lux's W. Your teammates suddenly become Faker when you try to aim them.

haha! I've seen teammates flash away from me when I try that.
Find me someone that can land a {{champion:45}}  w without his stun.  Protip, you cant
I have
Sad it is, the day people believe cc, required to hit {{champion:45}} w
The problem is, even if veigar places his W really well, I have time to realize "Oh man, he placed that well, I'm gonna get hit." and then walk away and take no damage.
Hectic teamfight is,  Aware of all, you are not.
You are right that people make mistakes.  Though it feels weird that without his stun, you are basically counting on it.  In many cases, Vei also depends on enemy mistakes in landing a stun.

I honestly feel that {{champion:45}} W is actually far more dangerous when you don't use his e during a hectic teamfight, because most people are of the mind, that he needs cc to land it, and with how subtle the animation for w is unless your specifically looking for it doing a teamfight.  They won't even try to move.

combine that with the fact that it does the same dmg as his ult (minus 180 flat dmg) yes it is dangerous. But it's the unreliability that makes it so aggravating for a skill shot. Out of all skill shots, I'd say veig's W has the most unreliability in it to compensate for what it does.
have morgana help him gg.
{{champion:80}} Ult! Its technically a skill shot...
Guess that makes {{champion:41}} Ulti the easiest.
{{champion:26}} when trying to land the 2nd bomb for the stun
{{champion:79}} ultimate.  Landing it isn't hard, but I say landing it correctly is very hard.

{{champion:34}} Pretty sure her Q is the single slowest missile in the game lol. It's not that skinny, but there's plenty of time to move at mid-long range, and if you have a teleport like Akali/Katarina you can just jump past it into melee every time.

Not that I find it hard myself, I just assume others might. :3
according to every blitz in bronze and silver, its {{champion:53}}'s Q.
As a soraka player, it's definitely not blitz's Q.
Yeah,a Definitely Not Blitz's Q is much more harder to land than a Blitz's Q.
bard ult... good lord{{champion:432}}

Landing Bard's ult is easy.
Landing it and not screwing over your team is the hard part.

I feel like AoE projectile skillshots like Heimerdinger's grenade, Nami's bubble, Zilean's bombs are the hardest to master (which is why they usually come with nifty effects  like CC or strong damage). Malzahar's Q is also one of those skills where you need a bit of practice to land it perfectly, reliably.
{{champion:432}}'s is hard if ur actually going for the stun.
{{champion:30}}  Ult. They juke it everytime...

Chain of Corruption.

{{champion:110}}
{{champion:101}} ult
According to Xmithie it's Sej ult.
Cass ulti
rivens ult clearly

I used to have problems with this one but tonight I got her in aram and started my ult just as the teamfight began instead of holding on to it.  First thing that happened is my hit rate went up and I actually got it off more.

Try ulting sooner and then release the blast when you need to.

That is how Riven's ult is meant to be used. It lasts for a long time, so you pop it early for the steroids, and then use it again for the for the kill. If you are trying to save it, and then double tap it just for the execute that is the wrong thing to do.
{{champion:98}} 's Taunt...
annies q
I think it has to be heim's stun
Viktor's E. That point of origin is hell on quick cast.

Word of advice from a player who has all his spells set to quick cast and self cast.
To correctly use vector targeting in quick cast, try placing your mouse at the origin point, then depressing the key and before releasing it, you drag your mouse in the direction you want the spell to go, then release.  Granted actually doing it should be quick like less then a sec, when your good, but i found that the best way to do it.
Good luck and i hope you get the hang of it.
{{champion:68}} Failing your R also leaves a big sign saying you did so
First time using {{champion:68}} ult

{{champion:62}} decoy is by far the hardest skillshot to land. You have absolutely no control over where it goes

Edit: {{champion:16}} e stun is another hard one
 Its also hard to land a GOOD {{champion:268}} ult

{{champion:432}}'s Ultimate.

EDIT: Just to clarify, I mean landing it on intended targets. It becomes pretty useless once a teamfight has already broken out because you usually hit just as many of your own players as their's.
{{champion:14}}

old heimerdinger E.
now I'd say nidalee max range Q.
or trying to hit ppl slightly out of range of your Q as eve or....
nunu E :^)
{{item:3092}}  its so slow and small for the skill shot portion

...  Nami Q and Ahri E are far from difficult skill shots.

Syndra E is only difficult now because of all the wonky changes, unless you meant hitting like a Bowling Split style, then it's insanely difficult.

-------

Anivia Q double hit, Heimer's W Ultimate probably the two hardest imo.  You might be able to land part of it, but landing the best case is much more difficult.
